author: VNExplorer
title: Joven fue al hospital por un dolor de rodilla y terminó perdiendo la pierna; esto fue lo que pasó
text:
Jade Crabtree es una joven británica que se ha vuelto viral tras dar su duro testimonio del momento en el que perdió una pierna después de presentar un fuerte dolor de rodilla, un caso que le está dando la vuelta a las redes sociales.
En diálogo con el Daily Mail, la protagonista explicó que todo ocurrió cuando tenía 19 años, momento en el cual empezó a sufrir de un intenso dolor en la rodilla, lo que le generaba malestar especialmente cuando caminaba. La mujer señaló que esta situación se desarrolló de un momento a otro, pese a que nunca sufrió ningún golpe.
El dolor en la rodilla se fue poniendo cada vez más intenso.
El dolor fue tan intenso que decidió asistir al médico, ya que además estaba acompañado con una gran inflamación de su articulación izquierda, lo que provocó que aumentara su temor por lo que estaba padeciendo. En el hospital fue sometida a una serie de exámenes por parte de su médico de cabecera, que le informó que presentaba una bursitis en esa rodilla.
Mayo Clinic, portal especializado de salud, explica que la bursitis es la inflamación de un saco pequeño lleno de líquido ubicado cerca de la articulación de la rodilla. “La bolsa reduce la fricción y amortigua los puntos de presión entre los huesos y los tendones, los músculos y la piel que están cerca de las articulaciones”, indica el portal.
Normalmente, esta afección se presenta cuando se realizan malos movimientos entre las articulaciones de esta parte del cuerpo, lo que ocurre especialmente cuando se practica ejercicio.
El diagnóstico no dejó muy convencida a Crabtree, ya que para ese momento trabajaba en una oficina y realizaba muy poca actividad física. Por ello, la mujer decidió cambiar de hospital y someterse nuevamente a unos exámenes para confirmar la información. Sin embargo, se llevó una gran sorpresa.
Tenía un tumor agresivo
La joven en verdad tenía cáncer en la rodilla.
La joven explicó que no tenía bursitis sino que los nuevos exámenes revelaron que en verdad el dolor en la rodilla era provocado por un tumor agresivo que necesitaba ser atendido de manera inmediata.
“Fueron necesarias seis o siete visitas al médico de cabecera antes de que me tomaran en serio y se dieran cuenta de que era una forma rara de cáncer de huesos que se encuentra en los adolescentes”, dijo.
Jade indicó que era consciente de que el dolor era por algo grave que tenía en su cuerpo, pero confesó que nunca se imaginó que fuera cáncer, por lo que la noticia la dejó en “shock”.
En verdad lo que tenía era osteosarcoma, un tipo de cáncer de hueso y que se encuentra con mayor frecuencia en los huesos largos, más a menudo en las piernas, pero puede comenzar en cualquier hueso.
La joven ha tenido que aprender a vivir sin su pierna y con una prótesis.
La noticia generó que su vida cambiara por completo, de inmediato tuvo que iniciar un tratamiento intensivo que, lastimosamente no fue suficiente, razón por la que tuvieron que amputarle la pierna con tan solo 19 años. “Aceptar el hecho de que iba a quedar discapacitada por el resto de mi vida fue y sigue siendo difícil de creer”, dijo.
Actualmente, Crabtree tiene 23 años y debe llevar una prótesis, pero afortunadamente tiene una vida libre de cáncer. “La mejor manera de afrontarlo es manteniendo una actitud positiva. No siempre es fácil, pero mejorará y la vida será más fácil”, finalizó la joven.

author: 小浪财讯
title: A500ETF（159339）跌0.73%，半日成交额6695.36万元_新浪财经_新浪网
text:
6月19日，截止午间收盘，A500ETF（159339）跌0.73%，报0.947元，成交额6695.36万元。A500ETF（159339）重仓股方面， 贵州茅台 截止午盘涨0.00%， 宁德时代 跌1.13%， 中国平安 跌0.93%， 招商银行 跌0.70%， 美的集团 跌0.65%， 比亚迪 跌1.40%， 长江电力 跌0.33%， 兴业银行 跌0.08%， 紫金矿业 跌1.44%， 东方财富 跌2.19%。
A500ETF（159339）业绩比较基准为 中证A500指数 收益率，管理人为银华基金管理股份有限公司，基金经理为马君、谭跃峰，成立（2024-09-26）以来回报为-4.51%，近一个月回报为-0.07%。

author: , Ashland Times-Gazette
title: Clinching OCC title will have to wait, as Ashland go down in OT to New Philadelphia
text:
ASHLAND − The atmosphere and vibe on Thursday night at home was all set up for the Ashland Arrows to wrap up the Ohio Cardinal Conference title, but the celebration will have to stay on hold for at least another game. In a matchup between the top two squads in the OCC that was plenty scrappy and hard-fought, New Philadelphia clawed its way to an 45-43 overtime win over Ashland, to split the season series.After the first quarter, Ashland (13-4, 9-1) was in plenty control with a 16-7 lead, but toward the end of the second quarter, New Philadelphia (12-6, 8-3) found some life and carried that into the start of the third quarter where they made a 9-0 run to cut the game to 21-19. For the rest of the third quarter, the Quakers grabbed the momentum and from there on, it was a scrap fest of a game.
More: Ashland County Girls Basketball Power Rankings: Loudonville notch big conference win "They were capitalizing on our turnovers, and we had a couple hiccups on defense," said Ashland head coach Renee Holt, describing the third quarter where her team got outscored 12-6. "They passed it over the top of our defense, and they made us work on defense."
A noticeable theme in this one was the many fouls that were called, with bodies from both sides hitting the floors often. Two of the Arrows' starters in Lauren Green and Cienna Steury fouled out late in the game."I found out the fouls were 8 to 2 at halftime," Holt said. "We fouled out two of our starters. It sucks but that's the style of play we play. We're up in your face and physical. We just have to adjust and be physical."The fourth quarter featured a couple of lead changes with key shots being made by Ashland's Madison Hoffman (17 points, five 3-pointers made) and Kennedy Lacey (10 points).
With New Philadelphia up 37-35, Ashland post player Camryn Cox (8 points) drew a foul and made two crucial free throws in the closing seconds of the fourth quarter to tie the game up heading into overtime.
In the overtime period, Ashland got a 41-37 lead and looked poised for victory. That is until the Quakers surged back with 6-0 run off a couple of drives to the basket. Even at 43-43 and four seconds left, two key free throws were made by New Philadelphia's Aubrie Wells that clinched the game for the Quakers.A key turning point Holt looked at, was that 6-0 overtime run by New Philadelphia."It was some breakdowns defensively, and they capitalized," she saidStill, with a 1.5 game lead over New Philadelphia and two league games remaining, the OCC title is still Ashland's for the taking. They will look to clinch it on Saturday versus Madison Comprehensive, who they defeated by 18 points in early January."We talked in the locker room," said Holt. "What a cool opportunity for this program. It hasn't seen a crowd like that for I don't even know how long. I told them to soak it up and don't hold your heads. The cool thing is we can still hold those numbers on the banner." jsimpson@gannett.com Twitter/X:@JamesSimpsonII

author: Aldís Amah Hamilton
title: Today is my "Moved to Iceland" birthday! Jeeeei!
text:
And what a strange day it is. Started off as a beautiful sunny day with no snow or rain or a mix of the two in sight, don't get those too often this time of year. The air was really crisp and clean and the light was beautiful. Of course it was really cold but not too windy. So after baking a cake and receiving guests it was time to go out for a refreshing walk.
The thought hadn't left my mind when I looked outside and once again... all was white! There was a snowstorm and it has now left Keflavík (I don't know about other places) completely white and the storm is so dense I can hardly see past my garden! But that's Iceland for you. The most cliché'd tourist saying we have is also the truest one: If you don't like the weather.... Just wait for a bit!
<---- How I picture our weather report for today...
Same goes for if you do like the weather, SEIZE the opportunity and make the most of it.
But this keeps us on our toes and has shaped our culture in so many ways. I guess you could say most of us have a love-hate relationship with the weather. My mom has some interesting thoughts about how it has moulded and defined us as a nation just like it has done to our mountains and plains: We've experienced the harshest weather conditions, even when natural disasters hit us two centuries ago and 75% of our livestock was killed as well as a fifth of our population. When Iceland was one of the poorest if not the poorest country in Europe (I think) at the time we got back up on our feet and our population has now reached 320.000! (According to the Icelandic population board at the restaurant Hamborgarafabrikkan http://hamborgarafabrikkan.is - Recommended!) And we were one of the wealthiest countries in the world until recently (very debatable, I know, but that's what the internet said and the internet neeever lies right?)
So the weather may have been perfect for half of today and terrible for the rest of it but I think we're all grateful for the lessons it's taught us! Good things don't just come to those who wait, sometimes you gotta make the jump when an opportunity presents itself. I've been doing that recently and it's worked out wonderfully so cheers to that! :)
In other news, today is the 19th anniversary of my mother and I moving to Iceland.. I was three years old and we'd been living in Germany. I couldn't be happier that we moved here, or "back-home" as I do like to say. :)
Have a great day and enjoy the weather!
P.s. props to my mother who has such a great eye for photography for my main photo! Unfiltered, taken a few years back of "downtown" Reykjavík. Here's a link to her website (she's not updating it at the moment but it's a great read for those interested in Iceland! Enjoy.)
p.s. it is now sunny again...
